Or am I forgeytting something?

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551559af6368726b44b90c00#post_551559af6368726b44b90c00
Well, the Purple Guy died. Plus, the kid was probably traumatized.
So, I guess even if the kid did remember, it wouldn't be that important since the authorities would probably find the bodies. I mean, the pizzaria had been renovated so it would be logical that they found it. 

Another thing that bothered me would the Puppet or Marionette. This guy is way out of the equation and it's almost impossible to find what relation he has to the mystery. All we know (if you play the minigames correctly) is that he gave cake to the crying kid and the fact that we CONTROL him.

Note, this guys is only available if you try to get the good ending. We control this weird dude with the Puppet mask through minigames and give cake.

Maybe the Puppet _is_ the leader and had always been trying to cheer the crying kid up? I mean, after the third game, it's obvious that the animatronics (except Spring Trap) aren't actually evil. Cursed is a better word.

topics.body: Okay Not!Seija Kijin calmed down and cut off best girl's arms.
topics.author: 4fdef063945b700a9d01604f

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55155edf6368726be5150900#post_55155edf6368726be5150900
Well, what we also know is that, in the second FNAF, his job is to give gifts to the children, as some of the drawing shows. And getting gifts make kids happy, so that's probably his job.

So, in one of the death mini games, he gave gifts to what appears to be four corpses. When he noticed they didn't look happy. He probably saw that they were dead. So, he gave them life. But, he still noticed they weren't happy yet (They're trying to get Jeremy). So, he decided to help them try to get you so they can be happy again.

At least, that's what I think about the Puppet, and what he does.

"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551562406368726c1e180900#post_551562406368726c1e180900
I actually like that.
That's very good. The random equation that has a small part but it is actually the crucial point of the story. If the kids were happy, the mass murder might not even had happened. It could've changed everything.

But once the kids are happy (after their deaths and animatronics), they leave the wounds of the pizzaria and rest in peace... and pieces, since the  animatronics and all.

Also, even though Foxy is a male (sorta), I like to imagine him being female. 
The name is soo fitting.

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5515681c6368726ec55f0100#post_5515681c6368726ec55f0100
Happy or not, the Purple Guy still murdered the kids.
Careless soul with a smirk on his damn face.
He got what was coming to him.

By the way, about that crying child being a survivor... I noticed something that disproves your theory.


As the Purple Man was dying of Springtrap, The Crying Child disappeared into thin air.

Now what kind of living being would do that?

Yeah, Foxy seems like a girl name. I sometime see him as a chick

Huh, I didn't think of it that way.

I just thought it was for us to focus on the Purple Guy or something. Well, in the end, only the creator (Bless you, Scott Cawthon) knows the story.

Also, ever wonder how Purple Guy was even able to put the suit on to begin with? I mean, that's a pretty long pause before the suit somehow kills him.








Also but not related, I hate it when someone uses food as an innuendo to talk about sex. I can't look at food the same way ever again!
